Portfolio

Mood Musicmore_vert

Github

close

I worked on this project with three others during the BoilerMake 24-hr hackathon at Purdue University. The application obtains the user's heart rate from their fitbit, sends it to a node server which communicates with Spotify API to produce a playlist of music tailored to the user's heartbeat at the time. We believed this would make it easier for music-listeners to pick their music rather than scroll through their library of songs. This application was built using NodeJS, HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

Proof of Concept BlockChainmore_vert

Github

close

I recently worked on this project at a hackathon hosted by UPS. At this hackathon, we built a proof of concept blockchain using Java, nodejs, and html to demonstrate its usefulness, efficiency, and security in place of the standard database. We presented our work to fellow interns and UPS higher-ups. Feel free to contact me for more details, the project repository is private for confidentiality reasons.

Tools and Experience

Past Experience

Technology Intern at UPS more_horiz

For my 2019 summer internship, I worked at the UPS Air Group Building in Louisville, Kentucky. A team of me and five other interns worked in scrum agile development using Spring Boot, Microsoft SQL, and Angular to develop applications. My main goal for this internship was to learn as much as I could about software engineering in the corporate world. I took part in a hackathon with my team as well. By the end of the internship, my group and I presented our work to an audience of UPS workers and fellow interns.

Summer Internship Program @ UC Santa Cruz more_horiz

I worked at UC Santa Cruz in the Biomedical Sciences Laboratory as part of the Summer Internship Program. Two other interns and I investigated the presence of Toxoplasama Gondii in cat colonies in Northern California. As part of the internship, we took samples at each site, cleaned them, and processed them in the lab. We analyzed the results using the language R. Our PhD mentor published a full paper that can be found at the following link:
